title: PAX Australia Panels - We want to hear from you!
body:
Hello Summoners!

PAX Australia is approaching! Last year we hosted a variety of panels around Esports, Cosplay and other subjects for both attendees and those who watched on YouTube.

This year we'll be heading to PAX again, but we want feedback from you on what you'd like to hear us talk about. 

Below are some subjects that our community and crew have expertise in, if there's something you'd like to hear us talk about please let us know in the poll below! You can only vote once, so make that vote count, if you're passionate about two make sure to sound off in the comments below. 

Cosplay Connoisseurs:
_What does it take to create some of the amazing cosplays you see at conventions? Find out as the experts take you through the process and answer your questions._

How to become an Esports Contributor:
_Esports are on the rise but it takes a lot of work to bring it from game to screen. How do you go from a spectator to someone who is involved in making this happen? _

Life of a Pro Player: 
_At the start of 2017 the OPL moved from being an online league to a LAN league, with players leaving behind their homes to live in Sydney. What is it like living in a house with 4 other players? What is the schedule like?_

How to Shoutcast: 
_Commentators are a core part of any Broadcast. Wether you're streaming an online tournament from your bedroom or Shoutcasting at the World Championship, there is always something to learn. Join our local Shoutcasters as they run you through what great casting looks like._

Esports Production:
_What happens behind the scenes of a broadcast? You may hear of producers and directors, but what do they actually do? Find out as the OPL Production team gives you an overview of how a broadcast is put together._

Mechs vs Minions Live Game: 
_Some Riot personalities sit down for some good ol' Mechs vs Minions. Will they succeed at the mission? Probably not, but that's half the fun!_

Other: 
_We would love to hear from you! Post any suggestions you have in the comments below!_

replies.body:
My biggest questions about PAX are regarding Neo Pax Sivir.

Speaking as someone who lives in a different country _(not to mention an entirely different continent)_ from where Pax is being held. It would cost an astronomical amount of money for me to attend, therefore it is highly likely, that just like all previous Pax's and many Pax's to come, I shall not be able to attend. Despite my wishes.

**My Question is:**
Why do I now have to waste 10 gemstones _(that I've worked hard for the last year just to get the 7 I have now, and most of them were bought)_ to get a skin I would get for free, if I just happened to live in a slightly different location? And I'm not the only one who will not be able to attend due to living in different cities/countries.


Discrimination by location is still discrimination.

It seems unfair for people to have to use up such valuable crafting resources to get the same skin that will be given away for free to those lucky enough to live near Pax.

What is your justification for this?

Thank you.

their justification is if you really cared, you'd abandon your work, your education, your family and savings and buy a plane ticket to attend. If you aren't willing to go that far, then you didn't truly want it anyway.

Ehhh Pax Sivir is just a nice little extra for those who went to Pax. The skin isn't that great to make one feel that it's unfair and 10 gemstones can be better used for the other skins on offer really. It's just a nice little goodie for those who went, not really discrimination(take the OCE specific events into account, it's a nice little goodie for those who are on the OCE server, not an attempt to say "fuck you" to other servers)

It doesn't really matter how good or bad a skin it is, it's a 'limited' skin. 
So basically if you're not at PAX, and don't have enough gemstones _(both things you have almost no control over,)_
You will NOT get another chance to buy it.

Which means future Sivir mains will miss out, current Sivir mains who can't go to PAX will miss out. 
Just to make the couple of hundred players that go to PAX feel special.

Hypothetically:
I could be a die hard Sivir main with 1 gemstone who lives in Rarotonga.
Which means It is pretty much impossible for me to get that skin.

Nothing about that seems fair to me! 
Does that seem fair to you?

All content in the game should be reasonably accessible to all players at some point.
Anything that is only available to some players and not others, is straight up discrimination.

Also nothing in ocean week is exclusive to OCE, the special icons and stuff we get are distributed to the rest of the world a couple of months later and are valuable for purchase _(as it should be)_, likewise with the 'ocean week-esq' events that the rest of the servers have.

Shh, that's literally the point of handing out exclusive content at events. It's marketing. To get people to go.

The game is accessible to you. That one skin will cost you, as it would anyone else not going to PAX. Should they also give you every skin that was given to players transferring to new regions for free?

His point is more the fact that it's only at PAX West. Like he could have flown to the US earlier this year for PAX East, or go to PAX AUS and still not get it.
IMO he's got a point and Riot should be giving out the code at all PAX's they're at, it just kinda makes more sense like that

> Should they also give you every skin that was given to players transferring to new regions for free?

Those skins weren't limited edition 1 time only skins.

If you can't go to PAX, or magically conjure up 10 gametes in the next couple of months, you will never own Neo Pax Sivir.

If youre going to make something limited time only, you should give all players an equal chance to get it. 
and _"Oh sorry, you weren't born in Melbourne? tough luck, you now have to fork out the single most valuable resource in the game to get a kinda average skin."_ isn't an equal chance.

The whole point of a limited time only event or item is so everyone does not realistically have the opportunity to get it, otherwise it's just plain ordinary.

I could go to PAX and get if I felt like it, but who cares, it's a digital skin for fucks sake, on a free to play game, chill.

No, the point of a limited time only skin, is that everyone has the opportunity to get it, only for that limited amount of time.

Which is different to 'limited edition' which means there are only a certain number made, but due to this being a line of code, there is an unlimited amount.

Cmon man, it's a bloody cosmetic item that doesn't affect the game (which doesn't affect anything in your real life). Do you REALLY care about that. It's just a fun thing for those that do go. In my opinion, the skin isn't even that great really.

It's not about the worth of the skin.
I agree its not even a great skin _(certainly not worth 10 gemstones)_.
But the point is, the people who **do** want it, have no control over if they can get it or not.

A beginner League player might live down the road from PAX, rock up on the weekend, get the skin, not really care, and quit playing league a couple of months later.

Where a Sivir main who lives in another country might desperately want this skin for Sivir _(after all its been around for so long but not been able to be bought)_, but not want to have to fork out hundreds and hundreds of dollars on a flight to US or Aussie, or a similar price farming chests.

Im not sure who your main is, but just imagine they released a one time only skin for them that you really liked, but said 
_"sorry mate, if you don't live in the czech republic, you cant get it. tough luck."_

Sure its not the end of the world, but you'd see people in game playing it, and it'd feel stink.
Aaaaah, see ur point now (only coz u made me imagine a czech jinx skin) {{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}} {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

Don't think anyone goes to PAX AU just for one free skin... They'll be a lot of people giving those codes out.. I get my PAX exclusive skins each year from a friend or twitter, should try there. 

On the other hand. It's just a game.. It's cosmetic. If you care about the skin that much, buy it. If you care about money so much play on Garena, stuff in the store is cheaper there.

I'd like to see a panel on how champions are concepted.
For example, how do you create the ideas for their abilities and lore, what type of theme and role they should fit, basically building a new champ from nothing rather than something like a rework.
Oooo, I like the sound of that!
Unfortunately thats what they did last year, they went through the design process of Ivern, like how he originally had no damage in his kit {{champion:427}}
Sounds like fkin bard! (1 dmg ability [unless u build bard like I do {rageblade, wit's end, ruunans, berkerker's, bork and gunblade}])

I was there for that panel too. It was great.
Honestly I would like to see more of this, or development discussion more focused to stuff that isn't their heroes.
New game mods.
New maps/balance decisions with current maps.
New items.
All play a huge roll in League.

Personally, I'd love to see Riot do something in relation to all the fanwork surrounding LoL (specifically in OCE, since this is for PAX AUS), especially considering all the fanwork contests that have happened over the past year or so. I think it would be nice to give some recognition to the creativity and dedication of the community.
I think it'd be really awesome to hear about applying/working for Riot and maybe learn about behind the scenes stuff for the game? I love stuff like the concept art and champion insights.
7. I'd like to see something to do with splash arts, the most beautiful part of league of legends. perhaps a process of it.
Yeah, I think some of the splash art is AMAZING (those blood moon skins this year were on point!)
Gimme A New exclusive AUS PAX Skin

I absolutely loved the cosplay panel last year and would really love to see something like that again! I would also love to see a panel on the process behind creating the art for League of legends, something on how the lore is created or more on Champ creation (since the one on Ivern last year was really fascinating).
I prefer panels about game and champion design, esports is only one element of the game yet 4/6 options are for esports.
This is because last year they did 2 panels on champion design. people weren't too happy about that i think so this year they are focusing more on esports

I went last year and I enjoyed the champion design panels, which is why I suggested it. I'm pretty sure the rest were for esports, I saw a couple but they just wern't very enjoyable for me. It seems like everyone was caught up in why the OCE pro scene is not as popular as other regions.

As I have been to PAX many of times, the one thing that I thing that convention is lacking is the opportunity to play n a stage. I see multiple booths that have the ability to play said "games" and prizes, but league isn't one of them, or even to play against league pros I also would like to available merchandise, like mechs vs minions to the tibbers onezie if possible.

Thanks and I hope this helps 
:)

Just gonna say I got to play an aram game with some and against some OPL players last year on a stage with a screen behind us and a shoutcaster. I got karthus but traded with one of the pros for kayle. There was one time where I ulted the Karthus and he Zhonya's immediately after and the shoutcaster was roasting us both for it lmao. In my defence I am a hardstuck Bronze 3 player, not a pro lmao.
was mad i played in one of those games too

They actually had a bit of a setup last year (and this year at Sydney Supanova too). I think it was under logitech? They had a screen up and would sometimes pick people from the audience to play and even had shoutcasters! It was pretty epic. I remember a few cosplay themed games that I watched people play.
yeah I do remember that but honestly one screen isn't really enough, but yeah would like to see a bigger booth tbh.
true :) A bigger booth would be awesome

It's in Melbourne

I'd actually like to see something from the 'promotional' side of things.
A lot of time and effort goes into the lore, comics, and cinematic teasers, I would love to hear more about them. What their process is, how ideas develop and so on.

A panel focused around OCE players and what is required to make it as a Pro.  Also would love to attend PAX but South Australia?

Holy mother never thought of that YES!

Hi Riot my first vote was for **How to become an Esports Contributor** because I want to do more for my community rather than just spectate games, I would also love to see a panel about the **Life of a Pro Player** as I aspire to become one as well, {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}} I've been playing League all the way since halfway through season 4 and I am still very passionate about the game, I've always wondered what it would be like to live in a gaming house and how everything works so I can determine my future a lot better since I'm thinking about doing other things as well, I watch a lot of OPL and learn a lot from the pro players as I watch them, It's a shame that SIN got knocked out of the Gauntlet, I've still got a long way to go in terms of being "pro" but I still believe I can get there with hard work and dedication so setting up a panel would give me more insight on what I'm really trying to get myself into. Thx  {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Even if everyone can't come and see each and every event with league of legends involved, the it gives those who live in that area the opportunity to maybe get something cool and unique to brag to their friends and count themselves lucky to live near home. {{champion:143}}

A panel on discussing innovation to improve LoL, new mechanics & new totally different maps, or even a story mode on your favourite champs, where you can play with friends to continue. Id like to see each champ made more personalised.
